abstract.p: George W White letter notes Jeffrey Goldberg's April 30 column on Jamie Rubin's marriage to Christiane Amanpour failed to metion that Amanpour is CNN foreign-affairs correspondent and Rubin is State Department spokesman

block.p: Jeffrey Goldberg's discussion of Jamie Rubin's marriage to Christiane Amanpour (The Way We Live Now, April 30) failed to mention a crucial issue. Amanpour is a foreign-affairs correspondent for CNN, while Rubin was the spokesman for the State Department. Given that the ostensible role of the news media is to report on (and, ideally, to hold accountable) public officials, shouldn't this striking conflict of interest have prompted a career change for Rubin or Amanpour long before the birth of their child?
